reviews.text: It is something more than a religious place. Environment around is simply superb. Best place to go if you want to relax and rest
Loving place. Calm and quite. Catholic faith. Open for any. You have to behave well. Thisis not an open space to enjoy yourselves but a cathedral.

Its really very calm and quite... its one of my favourite places in sri lanka..
A very beautiful place.

The peace and quietness combined with an atmosphere of holiness makes the whole experience worthwhile. I recommend a visit at least once to take in the rubber plantation that spreads across for acres of land belonging to the church where the annual church feast is also held each year in splendid glandor. It's relatively cooler under the shade, but it won't be complete without paying a visit to the church owned canteen which displays it's own food as well as varieties of wine prepared by nuns. Even the historic significance of the church still resides to this day with it's own museum, an underground shrine and much more.
Calm environment gives you a time to heal your soul. Spirit and body. Beautiful place to be

This is a very big church. The temperature inside is relatively high. Low light conditions at night time. There you can see a small library of books for adults and children. Inside there is a small playground for small kids.
Good place for pray
Worship
Historical church
Okay
A beautiful historic church. A standing proof of the mastery of old architecture.

Started as Parish in 1760 built between 1852 and 1873 blessed on 12.12.1887 and consecrated as Cathedral on 13.12.1938. An age old monumental church with some of the sculptures brought from Paris open for solemn individual prayers. There are good young fathers to help residing nearby. A rosary stall is also available.
Very Elegant and sacred place.
Quiet place. They open for us except it was closed. Try to find open hours before you go there...
God creates such a wonderful place

This is an amazing place to visit. Big collection of statues, big and small. Along with a huge tree that seems to be the focus of their worship. Lots of beautiful statues all in one place. This is basically two large buildings with many rooms and a court yard in the middle. But every inch is filled with beautiful items to behold!

One of the most important Buddhist temples in Colombo.  This is a really good place to calm your mind down. There are lot of valuable things to see here such as ancient statues, jewellery, ornaments and many more. Lord Buddha's Hair relics are also kept in this place for public worships.

Gangarama temple is a very popular Buddhist temple located in heart of Colombo. But this temple is well maintained. Clean and tidy. Parking is available in the premises. Even if it located in a busy town, this place is very calm and quiet. If you visit the place, make sure you wear charm, clean, light color (preferred white) dress. No shorts, sleeveless tops are allowed. Apart from the temple, there is a museum with antiques.

Absolutely iconic and a place to connect your inner self. I always believe that places like these have a very powerful pull and strong vibes, and I was right. Buddhist influences are all over the temple. My best was to be able to see Buddha in various forms. Please note that there is entry charge for foreigners ( a single ticket for this temple and the one near the lake). Inside the temple there is a glass cubicle wherein the priest shall offer a ritual to bless you by tying a holy thread and keeping his hand on your head. Must visit

A weird and wonderful place! Make sure to cover up and take off your shoes (scarves can be hired at entrance). It's full of completely random gifts and donations from around the world including a few Rolls Royce's and little pieces of history that are probably worth a fortune. An elephant even came in to get some treats from the tourists! Probably the weirdest place I found in Sri Lanka.
A Hindu Kovil!!!
a main sinhalease god ganisuru (also called ganapathi) the chief for the knowledge, is worshipped here. lot of hindus also worship him.
Marripuram muthumariamman
Ancient famous Sivan temple. Nice place. You all might love the interior design of the kovil. Try to go on early morning so you can feel the god.

The most beautiful yet bold and iconic temple in Colombo. Exquisite architecture of Granite and almost impossible stone carvings. This temple is closed during the mid day and usually opened in the morning and evening. Conservative clothes (ladies covering shoulders and below knee)
An architecturally beautiful temple. Peaceful and calming place.
Really nice Hindu temple. As I know this is old temple but maintaining properly. Temple has weddin hall. They are conducting sunday school. Inside it has calm environment.

This temple of Lord Shiva is built with granite stone with intrinsic sculptures. This temple fully built with granite. Situated right before the port and in the center of Colombo city. Lot of religious activities are carried out here. An. Glad to see young children boys & girls come here with traditional dress & participate in the activities of learning about the culture, attending lectures, reading & reciting religious history & songs. Temple is maintained neatly.

It's an Anglican church situated near Galleface (Next to KPMG) and Slave Island. It's situated in a calm environment. The church is of historical value of 165 years. A nice church to visit. Ample car parking facilities.

While in Colombo, visiting a masonic temple was on my list of priorities.

History is fascinating, and history of colombo is manifested here. You will see it in the masonry, woodwork and stained glass. 

I was fortunate to visit at a time when the temple was empty, the guards were excited to see an excited tourist. They let me look around patiently.

I reccomend a visit, if you are a patron of craftsmanship/theology/Spirituality etc.

Even if you are not, this is a mighty sight for an absolute idiot.
Founded in 1853, Christ Church Galle Face is located in close proximity to Galle Face Green.
Nice place to visit
Church where I have been worshiping for many years.

The Museum was Amazing. Price of admission LKR100 for Local. We spent around 5 hours there but if we read every text and looked at everything in detail we could've easily spent 1 day there.
Lovely Place, Interesting display of collection. Educating.Nice touch, very Clean and very friendly staff as well. Great for Students.   
I'd love to come back here.

I had read other reviews about this museum and thought the comments about the lack of air con were a bit precious, but they weren't. It was uncomfortably hot in there. The exhibitions make up for that however. There is a wealth of amazing artifacts for you to cruise. If you like museums then this is a must. As a bonus check out the street of people selling amazing paintings roadside at the back exit of the museum.

One of the best museums I've ever been to in my life. I was so impressed with the signage and the layout, the storytelling, the design. It was so delightful to also be able to see so much rich heritage without signs constantly reminding you about items stolen by the British (which are in the British Museum).

Museum with a lot of history from the dawn of time till modern days. More than 10 rooms containing history, artefacts and beauty. The building itself is gorgeous and the park is breathtaking. If you visit Colombo, this place is a MUST destination.

This is a great museum. The attached gem store is also government certified. The museum itself has a great short history of Sri Lanka in the first five rooms. Highlights include a kind of Rosetta stone, the fact that there was a canal system over most of the island several thousand years ago, and trinkets from various other civilizations due to Sri Lanka being on the sea silk route. About 2-3 hours needed. The colonial building it is in, is also nice. Go.

The Museum was Amazing. Price of admission LKR100 for Local. We spent around 5 hours there but if we read every text and looked at everything in detail we could've easily spent 1 day there.
Lovely Place, Interesting display of collection. Educating.Nice touch, very Clean and very friendly staff as well. Great for Students.   
I'd love to come back here.

I had read other reviews about this museum and thought the comments about the lack of air con were a bit precious, but they weren't. It was uncomfortably hot in there. The exhibitions make up for that however. There is a wealth of amazing artifacts for you to cruise. If you like museums then this is a must. As a bonus check out the street of people selling amazing paintings roadside at the back exit of the museum.

One of the best museums I've ever been to in my life. I was so impressed with the signage and the layout, the storytelling, the design. It was so delightful to also be able to see so much rich heritage without signs constantly reminding you about items stolen by the British (which are in the British Museum).

Museum with a lot of history from the dawn of time till modern days. More than 10 rooms containing history, artefacts and beauty. The building itself is gorgeous and the park is breathtaking. If you visit Colombo, this place is a MUST destination.

This is a great museum. The attached gem store is also government certified. The museum itself has a great short history of Sri Lanka in the first five rooms. Highlights include a kind of Rosetta stone, the fact that there was a canal system over most of the island several thousand years ago, and trinkets from various other civilizations due to Sri Lanka being on the sea silk route. About 2-3 hours needed. The colonial building it is in, is also nice. Go.

Unfortunately it's closed for renovations these days. Not sure when they will open it again. However it's good to note that if you're intending to take photos or videos you'll have to purchase a licence at the entrance. So keep that in mind when you're making your budget too. 

The licences are separately sold for photos and videos and both will cost you around Rs. 600. 

Hope this will be open soon.

Dutch musium is located in Pettah Colombo. History of this place runs down to 1600 AD. Now renovated as tourists attraction by UDA under Gotabaya Rajapakse. There are several  monuments that belong to Dutch era can be seen here

The two storey colonnaded building on Prince Street, Pettah (Colombo 11) which houses this museum was constructed during the Dutch occupation of Colombo (1656 - 1796) and was the formal residence of the Governor of Dutch Ceylon Thomas van Rhee (1634 - 1701) during his term of office in 1692 to 1697.The building has been used for many different purposes over the years. It was a teacher training college and an institute for the instruction of clergymen between 1696 and 1796. At one time it was the residence of Colonel Count August Carl Fredrick Von Ranzow (1759 - 1844). It operated as an orphanage under the supervision of the deacons and financed by the Dutch East Indies Company. It was also used as a hospital. It became a barracks in the second half of the 1800s and in 1900 it was used as a police training school, set up by the British.In 1932 it was converted to the Pettah Post Office. In 1971 following heavy monsoon rains one of the exterior walls collapsed and the building was abandoned. Following protests by the Royal Asiatic Society and the Dutch Burgher Union against plans to demolish the building, in 1973 a committee was established with representatives from the Ceylon Tourist Board, the Department of Archaeology, the Netherlands Alumni Association of Lanka and the National Archives, to restore the building and establish a museum covering the Dutch colonial period.
The restoration of the building commenced in 1977, with financial assistance of Netherlands government, and was completed in 1981. This museum was opened to the public in 1982. This building embodies the unique architectural features of a colonial Dutch town house. In 1999 the museum building was formally recognised by the Government as an archaeological protected monument in Sri Lanka. The designation was declared on 18 June under the government Gazette number 1085.
The museum while displaying the Dutch legacy with the artefacts including furniture, ceramics, coins and weaponry, portraying the various facets of contemporary life and culture.

The museum is located in the hear of Sri lanka's traditional shopping area. Its too busy to use a car, so make sure you walk. It's an off the beaten path Activity in Colombo and I recommend doing it. Just make sure you call ahead since they are renovating the place (see image).
Cool. Cannot believe once you go in. It's a life time experience. Please visit.

A peaceful and relaxed place to hangout and jog. If you are a Pokemon Go or Ingress Player this place has cool clusters and nests.
Independence Arcade has shops for shopping lovers and many restaurants for food lovers.

Lovely place to spend time in evening. Kids friendly. Lot of people come for jogging. Adjacent park has a free gym facility. There are some restaurants also with open seating for dinner. Ample parking available.

It is one of the most important and beautiful places in the heart of Colombo. And it is an awesome place to hangout and relax. Within weekdays and holidays this place would be a bit crowded.There is also Independence Memorial Museum that you can visit.
Looks nice and clean. Good place to just have a relaxed time. Surrounding area is very calm too.
Here you can come to do some sport like work out, jogging, yoga. And of course to take nice pics if you are a tourist in city

Economic history museum was disappointing. However the currency museum was good but not that well maintained . Old coins were covered with some kind of fungus and some of  the lights inside the show case were not working.

Built in 1914 it was the the tallest building  the city for more than a decade now houses Financial crime investigation Division and Economic History Museum with communication division in the ground floor and a beautiful display in the first floor. Worth visiting.

Owned and managed by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, one can learn as well as obtain elaborate information on the history of money in Sri Lanka in this museum. 

You will also also get a chance to see and learn how money is printed, various stages of money printing and coin minting and also security features embedded in currency notes in circulation in Sri Lanka.

The publication unit of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka is also situated in the ground floor of this same building, where you will be able to purchase periodicals and publications.

The building itself is a masterpiece of architecture, restored to its original form which it was in 1914.
Really bad behavior.. Working staff didnt care who visited them
This is where the famous FCID   and the currency museum and Colombo Port City office is located.

Spacious gallery that hosts all kinds of exhibitions all year round.

The parking here can be a little tricky, especially if there happens to be a popular exhibition. The road adjacent to the gallery is one way, and a part of it is closed off to make way for parking, but it can get filled up pretty quickly.

It is on of the best art galleries and theatre stages in colombo.
I have watched many productions here.
Each time I have not had anything  to complain about sound wise .
It's even got a tiny cafeteria/shop just for those tiny hunger bugs  and thirst, but you can't take the food into the theatre. 
They could improve the chairs, especially  the last row downstairs it is a little cramped up.
You can park on the road outside,on production days it gets jam packed.
It's well set up. I think if sounds from the theater can improve. Other than that nothing to complain about.
Love this gallery space. I've seen some of the best art from local artists here.

Being a thespian in English theatre in sri lanka, this is home to me and my colleagues.   The only theatre fully equipped for productions on any scale and one of the only one of its kind - acoustics are phenomenal here

This is definitely an awesome place to spend evening and have dinner with family or your friends. The view from here is magnificent and we were instantly delighted on entering the place. When it comes to the pricing, all the foods are expensive as 5 star hotels. They have built a new pool.
Amazing hang out spot with friends. Good pool and basketball hoop. Nice food

Old colonial members only club. You need to be a relative or affiliate of a member to come to The Colombo Swimming Club. 

Well stocked bar and good food is an attraction. Awesome place to watch the sunset over a chilled pint of local beer. BTW don't forget to try "Ravi's Special" cocktail if you happens to go there.

Always a great spot to chill. Members/ affiliates and their guests only. Great for kids and families. Also a nice spit for a drink and bites. Club rates means value for money... and the best hot butter cuttlefish in town :)

Quiet to the most part, love the food, specially the hot butter cuttlefish. But it's changed from the old recipe which I miss. It's always been a nice place to meet up with friends and enjoy their company. Staff are super nice too.

Small and cozy cafe. Wide variety of coffees and teas and well priced. Love the music and vibes. Free wifi is available here. I deducted one point because my pot of green tea was steeped in water that's too hot - it makes the tea taste more bitter than it should.

A quite peaceful place personally the ambiance wasn’t good but the place is a excellent place to relax over a cup of coffee. Lonny Paiva is very friendly and good interaction with customers. Would recommend for other too. Coffee is pre good not to mention their available varieties of not only coffee but also tea and all kinds of shakes for a extremely resonance price best part is you get to customize your food too if needed and the employees are really friendly would visit again for sure 🍪☕️

We have been in Sri Lanka for 2 weeks and they make the best iced tea we have ever had.
Toast was great too!

Nice coffee place but I wouldn't call it a specialty, they have packaged ground coffee, and roasting is done elsewhere, also it's more on the over roasting side, burn tastes no notes at all... Normal coffee
If you like fresh grounded home made coffee. This is the best place for you. I personally enjoy their coffee.

I love this place! Their food is just delicious, it’s a little pricy but it’s worth it. You can take your family, friends and even go for a date there. Service is excellent. Sadly I have only been there for lunch, but I want to experience their dinner too cos the ambience is way different than during the day time.

Very nice outdoor restaurant for romantic dinner. Beautiful interior and decorations. 
Amazing service and delicious food. 
Huge choice of deserts. 
I can recommend it like one of the best restaurant in Colombo.

Nice place to stay. The location is great. It is quiet and the atmosphere is also really relaxed. Food was amazing, just the size of the portion could be a little bit more for the price. Staff is friendly but if you are alone, they could pay a little bit more attention. Anyways I really recommend this place to anyone.

The food and the ambiance is amazing. It's a very nice place. But the service is very slow, we waited our food for a long time, about an hour. Although the food tasted amazing, it was worth waiting for. Just make sure you have plenty of time to spend.

Great place for a special occasion! There is a wide variety of choices for vegetarians and non-veg. Prices are certainly above average but the portions are decent and the food is delicious. Great space with calm and relaxed vibes. Try their mocha cheesecake and the schnitzel ! Delicious and 9/10

The place was so nice and food was delicious, staff there were also very pleasant, nice  and they briefed us about the menu and helped us to select the dish we want.  From the cashier to other staff, all are very attentive. After we finish they described about the available offers. Prices are but on high side, but worth the money spent. Only Indian cuisine with wide Indian spread.
One of the best Indian restaurants around Colombo. Highly recommend for anyone. Although food here are bit pricier they are so delicious. Also the service is quite good.

Loved their food. Every dish we ordered was great.
Great service too. Very clean place. 
Only negative is that it has limited parking. If you are coming in your own vehicle there's a good chance you may not find parking or you will have to park really far away and walk.
Would definitely go here again.

Awesome hotel and awesome food. Just loved the food for it's quality and also quantity. A must visit hotel for a traveller. You will love the food. But price wise if you ask, it's gonna dent your pockets as even packaged water costing Rs. 50 is charged at Rs. 225 plus 10% service charges and 18% taxes. Highly recommended for a group.

Is very expensive compared to the last time I visited here an year ago. But the food quality is same and good. But I would say you can get same or better quality food for lesser price in many other Indian restaurants around colombo.
It was a true example for an authentic street food shop. It's has all the aspects of taste, cleaneniness and good service. Prices are reasonable, definitely worth it experience. ✌️

One of the best street food joints in Colombo. Ordered their Egg kotthu with creamy cheese. Generous portions and taste was really good. Not spicy at all. ( note that they have more spicy kotthu in their Menu) Worth for the price tag.

As far as street food goes, this is one of the best in the city. A must try for anyone around. Tastes very good and the prices are reasonable for the quantity and the quality. Staff is very friendly too. Devilled chicken koththu is very good while others too were better than many popular koththu places around. Highly recommended.
Fantastic variety of foods. Especially who loves Kottu, there are the best. Seafood Kottu and roast chicken Kottu are the best. If anyone is like to have spicy Kottu, try nai miris Kottu. Fantastic

First tried road house kothu at a party and it was simply exceptional,literally couldnt wait to try again. Lately however the quality has gone down. I ordered via pickme recently and the kothu which is overpriced hardly had any chicken and make matters worse it was filled with chillie flakes making it extremely difficult to eat. Wouldnt bother with them. I have no idea why businesses drop their quality when customers increase...

I visit this place every now and then. My favourite dish here is STEAK WORKS CHICKEN  . Before today I had it 6 times. All the times it was good and no complaint at all. 

But today they disappointed me. As other days rice was ok..taste is awesome and how it looks was eye catchy... But grilled chicken was very very disappointing. It was rock hard.. I had to struggle to cut it with the knife. really dry.. Good this it was already cut in to strips otherwise someone can send to death by hitting with it.. Surprisingly it wasn't over cook too( I know stuff as I was an ex-chef ) .but still its hard I mean really dry and hard. I'm just thinking if they recook an old chicken???? :O :O :O

A really chill and convenient place to have a meal with your bunch, go talk what abouts with a old pal and have a beer... (you have to keep it chill and not go crazy ;) .. ). Good range of good. Recommended for eves and night

Have visited the UK many times over the years. Quality has gone up and down over the period. However I understand it has been under new management for the last year and I can certainly see really good improvements. I shall continue to use and now far more often. Please keep the new standards up the food is excellent
Most importantly they have enough parking. They had very good service and good good quality sometime back. Now their quality has gone down in good quality and service. But still its a not bad place.

Visited UK after a long time with a colleague. Was surprised to see the new method of weigh and eat scheme they have implemented. I guess this way people will not waste food by taking large portions. A very good initiative by the UK team. The place is clean and relaxing. Observed that a lot of office goers visit this place.
Excellent Service
Was a highend Swiss food.
A great place to get authentic Swiss food with atmosphere to match.
GOOD FOOD GOOD SERVICE AND GOOD AMBIANCE
Service and the ambiance are satisfactory, they need to improve on the quality of the food. We went for dinner, but dissapointed with their menu.
Decent fine dining joint. Had a good time. They clearly don’t seem to understand what is a healthy temperature for the room though.
Fine dining at its best. Lovely view and great ambiance. Service is goid.
Decent buffet

Great if you're a seafood lover. Great service, you should make a reservation if you plan to have dinner after 7pm. We orders the pepper and garlic crab and the prawn pot which was delicious. Be aware the smallest crab you can order is large despite what's on the menu, which is a enough for 2 people.

Wow such an amazing food,  the place is great the only thing that miss to have 5 star was the service we didn't like our waiter at all. We could see other waiters and they were doing a much better job than ours. I guess we had a bad luck.

Amazing food, great taste and very courteous staff. The service was quick and to the point. Table reservation is a must. We had faced just one issue- fighting off the flies. Ambience can definitely be improved for better.

Ministry of Crab holds true to its reputation of being one of the best eating joints in Colombo.

The crabs are fresh, and the curries are full of flavour and taste. Served with Rice and fresh bread - you can be assured of a delightful meal. The staff is courteous and professional that adds to the overall experience. The setting is in an old Dutch colonial building adding more value to your overall experience. 

Though you need to shell out some extra cash for the experience, it's totally worth it.

not my first time and neither will it be my last! a must visit for a crab aficionado visiting colombo! you feel like you are in crab heaven! each dish is a masterpiece of culinary perfection! make sure you make a booking, as the lines are long for both lunch and dinner. no liquor during the government ban time.
